alert.note: Alert for Chenango; Cortland; Madison; Onondaga; Otsego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 01 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following counties, Chenango, Cortland, Madison, Onondaga and Otsego. * WHEN...Until 115 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1213 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This along with earlier rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cortland, Norwich, Hamilton, Pompey, Owasco, Homer, Cazenovia, Brookfield, Otisco, Morrisville, Stockbridge, Nelson, Plymouth, North Norwich, Oxford, Preble, Sherburne, Lebanon, Scott and Truxton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
